text: Here in the states you can legally change your name. I should’ve, and will regret it for the rest of my life
author: ChroniclesOfAzu

text: I can’t even tell you how bad it was growing up... as soon I knew that a teacher was reaching last names starting with R, and saw the puzzled face trying to pronounce it I would just raise my hand, “rah-see-la, yeah, that’s me...”
author: ChroniclesOfAzu

text: My parents separated when I was little and I have little contact with my dad (other than being fb friends ). I still feel like I’m disrespecting my mom by not showing her last name on any of my bylines
author: ChroniclesOfAzu

text: My full legal name is Azucena Rasilla Solorzano. Ever since middle school I shorten my name to just Azucena Rasilla and foolishly let people butcher my first and last name. Never correcting them, and it’s something I highly regret  Thank you for educating these people
author: ChroniclesOfAzu

text: My biggest fear.... “I never said that.” I record EVERY interview, and label it by source/publication. I applaud journos who can memorize full on quotes. I just cannot, and the idea of getting one word wrong terrifies me. Team record your interviews

text: My beef is that people like her are falling in the same ways as MAGA folks. I get how infuriating the situation is, but if anything, other actual government officials have said worse. She would’ve been better off yelling at the leeches in Congress and the senate

text: I get it, but her way of screaming at her, equally hateful as those MAGA people. Chelsea has always been open to dialogue, even with people who call her names on twitter. She’s pregnant, imagine the stress of this girl yelling at her.
author: ChroniclesOfAzu
